bibl.title: Letter from John D. Long to [Wickliffe Rose], January 30, 1923

div1.p: Long reports that there is yellow fever in Ceara, Brazil, and that steamers from Ceara are due in New York.

div1.head: Letter from John D. Long to [Wickliffe Rose], January 30, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
Bureau of
The Public Health Service
Washington
January 30, 1923
div1.p:
Following telephoned over from Consular Bureau Department of State
and taken by L.A.R. at 3:20 P.M. and verified.

“A report has been received from the Consular Agent at Ceara
indicating that yellow fever is present and is very serious with
a tendency to increase. The steamers POLYCARP and SANTAREM which
are due to arrive at New York touched at Ceara. The American
colony there has asked the American Ambassador to urge the author-
ities of Brazil to adopt stringent eradicative measures.
PICKERELL”
Copies to the following places for their information.

New York Quarantine Station
Hampton Roads Quarantine Station
Mobile Quarantine Station
New Orleans Quarantine Station
Galveston Quarantine Station
International Health Board, 61 Broadway, N.Y.
div1.closer:
(Signed) J. D. Long
Assistant Surgeon General JDL/LAR
